metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6321 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the safer_name_suffix function in GNU tar 1.14 through 1.29 might allow remote attackers to bypass an intended protection mechanism and write to arbitrary files via vectors related to improper sanitization of the file_name parameter, aka POINTYFEATHER.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1
tar-scripts - 1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tar package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1').
